question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola withdraw any items from the market because of metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, on or before August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola makes a public announcement regarding the withdrawal of any of its items due to metal contamination. The withdrawal must be officially verified by Coca-Cola or a pertinent food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically pertain to metal substances discovered in the food items. If no such withdrawal takes place within the designated period, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?

question.title: Will both Coca-Cola and Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both Coca-Cola and Danone announce recalls of any of their products due to metal contamination. Each recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola for its products and Danone for its products) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If either company does not have such a recall occur within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola and Danone both issue recalls for any products because of metal contamination before August 2024?

Each recall must be officially acknowledged by the respective company (Coca-Cola for its products and Danone for its products) or a relevant food safety authority (like the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal substances found in the food items. If neither company has such a recall within the designated period, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Coca-Cola or Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?

The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs for either company within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola or Danone initiate a product recall because of metal contamination before August 2024?

The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances present in the food items. If neither company executes such a recall within the designated period, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is a public vote on healthcare reform expected in Illinois before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially carries out a public vote specifically aimed at implementing healthcare reform within the state. The vote must be formally declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and must be planned to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must directly pertain to healthcare reform. This inquiry will be answered with a NO if no such vote is officially declared or executed by the given date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a possible vote does not meet the criteria for a YES answer; the actual vote must be arranged or conducted within the defined timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Pennsylvania regarding renewable energy projects before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by the end of August 2024, Pennsylvania carries out an official public vote specifically aimed at adopting renewable energy projects within the state. For an affirmative outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main subject of the public vote must center around renewable energy projects.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be reported by official state sources or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If such a public vote does not take place or is not finalized by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative. Proposed votes that have not been officially held by the resolution date do not qualify for an affirmative outcome.

question.title: Will both Illinois and Pennsylvania hold referendums on healthcare reform and renewable energy initiatives, respectively, by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the following conditions are met: (a) Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. (b) Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, and the primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If either of these referendums does not occur or meet the specified criteria by August 31, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Are both Illinois and Pennsylvania set to conduct referendums regarding healthcare reform and renewable energy projects, respectively, by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Illinois officially carries out a public referendum aimed specifically at instituting healthcare reform within the state. The question posed in the referendum must directly pertain to healthcare reform. (b) Pennsylvania organizes an official public referendum aimed specifically at advancing renewable energy initiatives in the state. This referendum must be officially announced and executed by the state of Pennsylvania, with its primary focus on renewable energy initiatives. The outcomes of the referendum must be reported publicly through official state channels or recognized news outlets. Should either of these referendums fail to occur or not satisfy the outlined criteria by August 31, 2024, this inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will either Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform or Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. Merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

(b) Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives, and the results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

If neither of these referendums occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Illinois will conduct a referendum on healthcare reform or Pennsylvania will initiate a referendum on renewable energy programs by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following happens by August 31, 2024:

(a) Illinois carries out a public referendum aimed specifically at implementing healthcare reform within the state. This referendum must be officially declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the referendum must directly relate to healthcare reform. Simply collecting signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES outcome; the actual referendum must be planned or executed within the designated timeframe.

(b) Pennsylvania holds an official public referendum that specifically targets the establishment of renewable energy initiatives in the state. The referendum must be officially announced and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania. The main emphasis of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives, and the outcomes of the referendum must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or well-known news outlets. Proposed referendums that have not been officially executed by the resolution date will not be considered for a YES conclusion.

If neither of these referendums takes place by the specified date, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid plan that incorporates a community engagement requirement for its beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be an essential aspect of the plan. For a positive outcome, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially enacted, not just suggested or being contemplated. If no additional state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the weekly initial claims for unemployment in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for a duration of four straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go over 275,000 for a period of four consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be marked as NO if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. For the purpose of resolution, only the official statistics published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024 (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. There must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events will happen: (a) By July 2024, another state in the U.S. implements a Medicaid plan that requires community engagement, and (b) There are more than 275,000 weekly jobless claims in the U.S. for four straight weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES only if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (a) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid plan that mandates community engagement for its beneficiaries. The community engagement aspect must be a fundamental part of the plan. There should be an official statement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially in place, not just proposed or under discussion. (b) The count of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, surpasses 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. Only official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account. If both criteria are satisfied, the inquiry will be deemed YES. If either or both criteria are not satisfied, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement, or (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (a) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan, and there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. If neither condition is met within the specified timeframes, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) Another state in the U.S. implements a Medicaid program that requires community engagement, or (b) The weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for four weeks in a row?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following criteria is satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, a U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid program that mandates community engagement for its beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a fundamental aspect of the program, and there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from at least two credible national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, not just proposed or under consideration. (b) The weekly initial unemployment claims reported by the U.S. Department of Labor exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time between now and August 31, 2024. If neither of these conditions occurs within the given time frames, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a prominent cybersecurity firm's main office be entirely moved to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a significant cybersecurity firm has completely shifted its main office from its original site to Austin, Texas. For the outcome to be positive:

1. The move must be officially declared by the firm or its executives.
2. The declaration must be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new main office must be functioning in Austin, Texas, with essential executive operations relocated.

Incomplete relocations or plans that are still underway by July 31, 2024, will not suffice for a YES resolution. If the relocation is not finalized and operational by this date, or if the firm opts against the relocation, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the U.S. government will initiate further legal proceedings against Google before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Google is subjected to new legal proceedings started by any entity of the U.S. government. These proceedings might encompass, but are not restricted to, lawsuits or regulatory measures. For these to be considered, the legal proceedings must be officially disclosed and reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from any existing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered in the negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major cybersecurity company fully relocates its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024, and (b) Google faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this to be true:
   1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
   2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
   3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.
   Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Pennsylvania to hold a referendum regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public referendum that is specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES determination, the following conditions need to be fulfilled:

1. The referendum must be officially declared and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main emphasis of the referendum should be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the referendum must be made publicly available through official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no referendum that meets these requirements takes place by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a referendum without it actually occurring by the given date does not satisfy the criteria for a YES answer.

question.title: Will Tennessee enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will new abortion laws in Tennessee be more stringent than those for other medical providers before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee introduces new legislation or regulations that impose more stringent criteria on abortion providers compared to those applicable to other medical providers. The implementation must be verified by official state legislative records or reported by at least two credible news outlets. More stringent criteria may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards that are unique to abortion providers. If no such legislation or regulations are established by the resolution date, or if any established laws or regulations are uniformly applicable to all medical providers, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights and (b) Tennessee enact stricter abortion regulations?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The criteria for a YES resolution include:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a referendum on abortion rights in Georgia by August 2024, or will the FTC declare the end of a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024?
para_P.body:

The inquiry will be marked as NO if no such referendum takes place by August 31, 2024, if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed past the specified date, or if a referendum occurs but does not concentrate specifically on establishing protections for abortion rights. Note: The outcome of the referendum is not relevant to this question; only its occurrence within the designated timeframe matters.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces that it has concluded its investigation into pricing practices that utilize personal data to tailor prices based on individual customer traits. This investigation must involve at least five major companies. The conclusion must be validated through an official announcement from the FTC or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not declare the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains active, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 15-year mortgage rise above 5.5% by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Central Bank of New Zealand will reveal a new economic stimulus initiative before August 2024?

The declaration should clearly outline the new economic stimulus initiative. Additionally, it must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for South Korea's KOSPI index to hit or surpass 3,500 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Pennsylvania regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be officially initiated and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The central theme of the vote must be the protection of abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or widely recognized news outlets.

Should no such vote that meets these conditions take place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that simply proposing or planning a vote without its actual execution by the specified date does not fulfill the requirements for an affirmative outcome.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is Missouri going to eliminate the work requirement from its Medicaid program by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri's government makes an official statement regarding the elimination of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This alteration must be verified through formal state communications or reported by at least two prominent news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement signifies the stipulation that beneficiaries are obligated to work or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If there is no such declaration by the deadline, or if the work requirement continues to be enforced, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

The question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approve a significant economic reform bill that Prime Minister Sunak is against by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom approves a significant economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. To be considered valid:

2. It needs to be approved by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be clearly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be referred to as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential influence on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but fails to meet all the criteria mentioned above, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Apple secure a union agreement with its retail staff in Ohio before July 2024?

   4. The bill must be labeled as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets in terms of its potential influence on the UK economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Apple has completed and officially signed a collective bargaining agreement with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must be provided through official announcements from Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or reported by at least two credible news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). This contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If both of these occurrences take place by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as TRUE. If either or both events do not happen, the question will resolve as FALSE.

question.title: Will either the UK House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by PM Sunak by August 2024, or Apple finalize a union contract with Ohio store employees by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) The United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration by August 31, 2024. The bill must meet the following criteria:
   - It is related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   - It is passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   - Opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration is clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The bill is described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

(b) Apple finalizes and officially signs a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio by July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

This contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If neither of these scenarios occurs by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from the Bank of England regarding a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Bank of England makes a formal declaration of an interest rate reduction intended to take effect by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England, including press announcements, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If such a declaration is not made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be considered negative. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate cut takes effect may occur after August 31, 2024, provided the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary mechanism for the Bank of England's monetary policy.

question.title: Will GNC Holdings emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will GNC Holdings successfully exit bankruptcy by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if GNC Holdings officially exits its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings by July 31, 2024. This exit must be verified by at least two credible financial news organizations (like Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official statements from the company or court documents. The exit should encompass a court-sanctioned reorganization plan that enables GNC Holdings to operate with a restructured financial framework. If GNC Holdings is still in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or does not exit bankruptcy by the designated date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

If all these criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If any of these criteria are not fulfilled by that date, or if the conversation does not take place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United States implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

The tariff should specifically apply to electric vehicles made in China and should not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all types of vehicles. If no such tariff that fulfills these requirements is enacted by the given date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of July 2024, Italy's economy does not fall into a recession. A recession is characterized for this question by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as indicated by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if Italy's economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Will there be a monthly rise in the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric that surpasses 0.5% by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially reported by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government agency (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such rise is documented during this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession, and (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization conclude that the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak has ended by August 2024?

If there is no such announcement declaring the outbreak over by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will result in a NO.

The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:

2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:

1. The vote must be formally announced and executed by the state of California.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be disclosed by official state sources or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually holding it by the given date does not meet the criteria for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

'Substantial' in this context refers to at least 50% of the known online trading platforms operated by Chinese entities in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The closure must stem from government policy or directive, rather than voluntary shutdowns or economic circumstances. If no enforcement satisfying these conditions is confirmed by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). This does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability. (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

It is not necessary for the court to determine that the operator is liable; a ruling on the liability issue is sufficient. (b) The Federal Reserve's main inflation gauge (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially announced by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government body (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If neither of these situations occurs by the specified deadlines, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to beef result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to beef from a specific supplier. question.title: Will Washington maintain its $16 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is the French economy going to steer clear of a recession by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by the date of July 31, 2024, the French economy does not fall into a recession. A recession is characterized, for this question, as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the French economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nicholas Collon is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on his age at the time of his appointment to a major orchestra, such as the London Philharmonic. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that he is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

question.title: Will the NFL settle the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for less than $4.7 billion by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if by July 31, 2024, the NFL reaches a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for an amount less than $4,707,259,944. The settlement must be officially confirmed through court documents or public announcements by involved parties. If no such settlement is reached by the resolution date, or if the settlement amount is equal to or more than $4.7 billion, the question resolves as NO. For context, as of October 1, 2023, a federal jury has ordered the NFL to pay this amount for violating antitrust laws in distributing out-of-market Sunday afternoon games on a premium subscription service.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will the current legal position on abortion access in Illinois remain unchanged by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state regulations imposing stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common second-trimester procedure. The answer will be NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reintroduced stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. question.title: Will the HHS's rule on telehealth services be enacted by August 2024?

Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If no such rule is enacted and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. Michigan carries out a public referendum specifically aimed at securing abortion rights protection by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be officially declared and executed by the Michigan state government, directly addressing the matter of abortion rights protection, and the outcomes must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or well-regarded news outlets. The question will be answered with a NO if neither of these conditions is satisfied by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net earnings rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter last year by July 2024?
