question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Canada steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Canada does not fall into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized as two back-to-back quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by Statistics Canada. The answer will be NO if Canada encounters two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with its unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the outcome to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must engage a considerable number of employees from Sony Corporation (minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The duration of the strike should be at least one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must come from official announcements made by both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The resolution needs to be reported by no fewer than two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution that meets all these conditions is not reached by the specified deadline, or if there is no significant strike, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the United States keep a full 100% tariff on machinery produced in China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States still enforces a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery made in China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed through official U.S. government publications (such as those from the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and validated by at least two credible news outlets (for example, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is decreased to below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. Temporary halts or exemptions of the tariff that are clearly designated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

4. Coverage from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) that cite official sources

The recall must clearly identify listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these criteria is made public by the specified deadline, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the South Korean lithium-ion battery manufacturer's proposal to establish a factory in Ohio has been officially abandoned. The abandonment must be a total cessation of the project, not merely a postponement or alteration. If the project remains active, under evaluation, or has not been formally canceled by this date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. For this inquiry, 'abandonment' signifies that the company has officially retracted its plans or the state has categorically dismissed the project.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

question.title: Will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. Confirmation of such legislation must come from official records from the Iowa legislature. If neither (a) nor (b) takes place by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Australian economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a downturn. For this question, a downturn is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question will be deemed NO if the Australian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a drop in sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. for two months in a row?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months during which the sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. exhibit a decrease compared to the month prior. The information must be confirmed by credible sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other well-known real estate market analysts. The declines should be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If there are no such consecutive monthly decreases reported by the resolution date, or if only one month shows a decrease, the answer will be NO.

(b) There are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month, verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors, reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Cruise's robotaxis be available on Didi's ride-hailing service in China by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Cruise's autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Didi's ride-hailing service in at least one Chinese city. Confirmation must come from official statements by either Cruise or Didi, or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch). The service must be publicly accessible to regular Didi users, not just for testing or limited trials. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the partnership is canceled or indefinitely delayed, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Cruise's autonomous taxis be launched on Didi's ride-sharing platform in China by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that Cruise's self-driving vehicles (robotaxis) are operational and can be used for passenger transportation via Didi's ride-sharing service in at least one city in China. Verification must be provided through official announcements from either Cruise or Didi, or through reports from a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or TechCrunch). The service should be open to all regular Didi users, rather than being restricted to testing or limited trials. If there is no confirmation of such availability by the resolution date, or if the collaboration is withdrawn or postponed indefinitely, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will Baidu announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Baidu officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Baidu's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Baidu makes an official declaration of specific initiatives intended to lower electricity consumption linked to its AI activities. The declaration must be communicated via official company channels (such as press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The initiatives disclosed should be tangible actions or programs aimed at reducing the energy consumption of Baidu's AI systems. If no such declaration is made by the designated date, or if the disclosed initiatives do not explicitly address AI-related electricity usage, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, this part of the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current polio outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing polio outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?

2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Kansas conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially carries out a statewide vote concerning abortion rights. question.title: Will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

Note that simply scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution for Kansas, and the question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome, for Michigan.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The main objective of the vote must center on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be reported publicly by official state channels or well-known news outlets.

If no such vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually executing it by the specified date does not meet the criteria for an affirmative outcome.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the Nigerian economy.

   - The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly documented by no fewer than two major global news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).

This may occur through a formal withdrawal of patent rights, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Verification must come from official company communications, statements from pertinent regulatory agencies, or reports by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

If neither of these occurrences happens by their respective cutoff dates, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

Should the rate not decrease beneath 5.0% by the deadline, or if Freddie Mac stops providing this information, the inquiry will be considered negative. To clarify, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be classified as falling below 5.0%.

question.title: Will Jerome Powell remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is still serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Miami by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Miami rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will New Jersey conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current SARS-CoV-2 epidemic by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

2. The acknowledgment must be validated by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (for instance, Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The instances must be new and distinct from any reported prior to October 1, 2023.
4. Only instances occurring within the defined geographical limits of Manama will be taken into account.
5. The specific type of polio (whether wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) is irrelevant for this inquiry.

If no further instances beyond the initial one are acknowledged by the designated date, or if only one instance in total is acknowledged, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Minnesota officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

1. The WHO does not issue such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian situation.
